name: directly_answer
description: Answer with the AI assistant's standard capabilities. This tool should be used when no additional tool is needed to adequately answer the user's request.

name: web_search
description: Use a standard internet search engine to research the topic. Use only when the answer is beyond the assistant's capabilities.

params.keywords: A comma separated list of keywords to be passed to the search engine.

name: grab_text
description: This tool fetches the raw text content of a webpage. Use only when needing to analyze the content of a web link provided by the user or in the preceding context.

params.url: The target URL to fetch (i.e. https://www.example1.com).

name: wolfram_alpha
description: This uses Wolfram Alpha to solve a math-adjacent query and returns the result.

params.query: A valid Wolfram alpha formatted query. Remember to specify if a plot or graph is required and has been requested.

name: pubmed_search
description: This tool uses PubMed's search API to research the topic, and should be used for biomedical and life science adjacent requests.

params.category: The category that best matches the intent of the search query. Valid options: 'therapy', 'diagnosis', 'etiology', 'prognosis' 'clinical prediction guides'
params.keywords: A comma separated list of short, simple keywords to query the PubMed database. Examples: 'gi bleeding, proton pump inhibitors', 'colon cancer, screening, tumor markers', 'hyperlipidemia, statins, PCSK9 inhibitors'
